title: Echoes from the Deep
summary: A race against time to stop a cult from opening a gateway to the Far Realm beneath Waterdeep
hook: With only three days until the full moon, the party must track down Malaketh and his cult to prevent them from completing a ritual that would open a permanent gateway to the Far Realm. Their investigation leads them to a forgotten temple in the depths beneath Waterdeep.
background: The Watchers of the Void were an ancient cult dedicated to entities from the Far Realm. They were thought to be destroyed centuries ago, but Malaketh has revived the order. He seeks to use the Eye of the Deep, an artifact that resonates with Far Realm energy, to tear open the barriers between worlds. The cult has kidnapped nobles to use as sacrifices in their ritual.

acts.title: The Calm Before the Storm
acts.summary: The party has three days to prepare for the confrontation. They gather allies, research the cult's ritual, and discover the location of the hidden temple.
acts.description: The session begins with the party recovering from their battle at the mansion. They have rescued the nobles but Malaketh escaped with the Eye of the Deep. Documents found at the mansion mention a 'temple of the void' and reference ancient sewers beneath the Dock Ward. The party must decide how to spend their limited time: gathering allies, researching the ritual, or investigating the temple's location.
acts.objective: Prepare for the final confrontation and discover the temple's location

scenes.title: Debriefing at Blackstaff Tower
scenes.description: Vajra Safahr examines the cult documents and reveals information about Far Realm rituals. She warns that if the gateway is opened, it could corrupt the entire city. She offers limited magical support and suggests contacting the Harpers for reinforcements.
choices: Ask for magical items or scrolls
Request a warding spell for protection
Seek information about closing Far Realm portals

scenes.title: Rally the Allies
scenes.description: The party can reach out to their faction contacts. Remallia Haventree can provide Harper agents, Davil Starsong might share Zhentarim intelligence, and the city watch can secure the area. Each contact requires persuasion and comes with strings attached.
scenes.location: Various - Yawning Portal, Harper safehouse, Zhentarim hideout
choices: Focus on Harper support (stealth and intelligence)
Work with Zhentarim for muscle and resources
Coordinate with city watch for backup
Go alone to avoid political complications

scenes.title: Into the Deep Sewers
scenes.description: Following clues from the mansion, the party explores the ancient sewers beneath the Dock Ward. They discover a hidden passage marked with void symbols, leading deeper into forgotten tunnels. They encounter corrupted creatures and traps left by the cult.
choices: Move quickly but risk triggering traps
Move carefully and scout ahead
Try to communicate with corrupted creatures

acts.dmNotes: Allow the party to feel the time pressure but give them meaningful choices. Each ally they recruit should provide tangible benefits in later acts. The sewer exploration should be tense but not depleting.

acts.title: The Temple of the Void
acts.summary: The party enters the forgotten temple and fights through cultists and aberrant guardians to reach the ritual chamber.
acts.description: The temple is a nightmarish fusion of ancient architecture and Far Realm corruption. Walls pulse with unnatural energy, geometry seems wrong, and whispers echo through the halls. The cult has fortified their position with traps, corrupted guardians, and fanatical defenders. As the party progresses, they notice signs that someone else has recently passed through - possibly Theron's mother.
acts.objective: Fight through the temple and reach the ritual chamber before midnight

scenes.title: The Entrance Hall
scenes.description: A grand hall corrupted by void energy. Pillars are covered in writhing tentacles of shadow, and the floor is inscribed with maddening patterns. Cultists stand guard, and an altar holds a disturbing statue of an aberrant entity.
choices: Fight directly through
Use stealth to bypass some guards
Attempt to create a distraction

scenes.title: The Hall of Whispers
scenes.description: A corridor where walls seem to breathe and whisper secrets in unknown languages. Each character must make Wisdom saves or be affected by disturbing visions from the Far Realm. At the end, they find evidence of Theron's mother - a journal entry warning about the cult.
choices: Rush through and resist the whispers
Study the visions for useful information
Use magic to shield minds

scenes.title: Guardian Sanctum
scenes.description: A large chamber where the cult has bound aberrant creatures to serve as guardians. The party must defeat these entities while avoiding environmental hazards from Far Realm energy.
choices: Focus fire on largest threat
Try to unbind the creatures
Use environment against enemies

outcomes: Theron discovers truth about his mother
Some party members suffer temporary madness
acts.dmNotes: This act should feel desperate and alien. Use vivid descriptions of Far Realm corruption. Let the tension build toward the final confrontation.

acts.title: Midnight at the Gateway
acts.summary: The final confrontation with Malaketh as he attempts to complete the ritual and open the gateway.
acts.description: The party arrives at the ritual chamber as Malaketh begins the final phase of his ceremony. The Eye of the Deep hovers above an altar, pulsing with dark energy. Reality itself seems to fracture around the ritual site. The party must stop Malaketh while preventing the gateway from fully opening. In a shocking revelation, Theron discovers his mother is alive but corrupted, serving as Malaketh's lieutenant.
acts.objective: Defeat Malaketh and close the gateway before it fully opens

scenes.title: The Ritual Begins
scenes.description: The party bursts into the chamber to find Malaketh channeling energy from the Eye of the Deep. A swirling portal to the Far Realm has begun to form. Sacrificial victims are bound around the altar. Allied NPCs arrive to help but must hold off cultist reinforcements.
choices: Disrupt the ritual immediately
Free the sacrifices first
Target Malaketh directly
Try to destroy the Eye of the Deep

scenes.title: Mother's Truth
scenes.description: Theron's mother, now calling herself the Void Prophet, reveals herself. She was investigating the cult years ago but became corrupted. She believes the gateway will bring 'enlightenment.' Theron must choose between fighting her or trying to reach her humanity.
choices: Fight her as an enemy
Attempt to redeem her
Use the situation to exploit the cult's division

scenes.title: Closing the Gateway
scenes.description: With Malaketh defeated or weakened, the party must close the gateway before aberrations pour through. This requires either destroying the Eye of the Deep (causing an explosion) or using it to reverse the ritual (risking corruption). The choice has lasting consequences.
choices: Destroy the Eye (guaranteed success, area damage)
Reverse the ritual (saves artifact, Wisdom save or corruption)
Let someone sacrifice themselves to seal it

challenges: Time limit before gateway fully opens
outcomes: Gateway is closed, temple begins collapsing
Theron's mother is redeemed or lost
Eye of the Deep is destroyed or secured
acts.dmNotes: This should be epic and emotionally charged. Allow player choices to matter. Have allies contribute to the fight. The aftermath should feel earned.

npcs.name: Malaketh the Void-touched
npcs.description: A gaunt man with eyes that seem to contain swirling galaxies. His skin has a faint purple sheen and occasionally ripples as if something moves beneath it. He wears robes covered in alien runes.
npcs.personality: Malaketh is utterly convinced that opening the gateway is the only path to true enlightenment. He speaks in a calm, almost pitying tone to those who oppose him, viewing them as ignorant children. His sanity is clearly fractured, but his intellect remains sharp.
motivations: Open a permanent gateway to the Far Realm
Spread the 'truth' of the void to all
npcs.backstory: Once a respected scholar of planar magic, Malaketh's research into the Far Realm led to his corruption. He discovered texts about the ancient Watchers of the Void and became obsessed with their teachings. He has spent years gathering followers and resources for this ritual.
dialogueHooks: You cannot stop what has already begun. The void calls, and we must answer.
Your minds are so small, so limited. Let me show you infinity.
The lords of Waterdeep think themselves powerful, but they are nothing compared to what lies beyond.
knowledge: Identity of infiltrators in various factions

abilities: Armor of Agathys (temporary HP and damage)

npcs.notes: Malaketh should feel like a serious threat but not unbeatable. He'll use minions and environmental advantages. If reduced to low HP, he'll attempt to complete the ritual at any cost.

npcs.name: Seraphina Swiftblade (The Void Prophet)
npcs.description: Bears a striking resemblance to Theron but with hollow eyes that occasionally flash with alien light. Her movements are eerily graceful, almost floating. She wears dark leather armor inscribed with void symbols.
npcs.personality: Torn between her corrupted self and buried memories of her son. The void has given her power but at the cost of her humanity. Moments of recognition can break through her controlled exterior.
npcs.backstory: Seraphina was a Harper agent investigating the Watchers of the Void fifteen years ago. She went too deep and was captured. Rather than being killed, Malaketh saw potential in her and corrupted her slowly over time. She now believes the void is salvation.
dialogueHooks: I remember... a child's laughter. But that life was a shadow. This is truth.
Theron? That name... it hurts to remember.
The void has given me more than you could ever understand.
npcs.notes: Seraphina should be defeatable without killing if the party tries. Theron's actions and words can influence her. She can be redeemed but it requires effort and sacrifice.

locations.name: The Ritual Chamber
locations.description: A vast circular chamber deep beneath Waterdeep. The ceiling is lost in darkness, and the walls are covered in pulsing void glyphs. At the center stands a black stone altar holding the Eye of the Deep. The air itself seems to ripple with wrongness. A swirling portal to the Far Realm dominates one wall, growing larger with each moment.
locations.atmosphere: The temperature fluctuates between freezing cold and stifling heat. Strange whispers echo from nowhere. The light from torches and spells takes on an unnatural purple hue. Gravity seems slightly off, making movement feel wrong.
features: Black stone altar (can be damaged to disrupt ritual)
Void glyphs on walls (arcana check to understand)
Unstable floor sections near the portal
secrets: Ancient counter-ritual inscribed on altar base
Seraphina's Harper badge hidden in a crack
locations.mapReference: Roughly 60ft diameter circular room. Altar at center. Portal on north wall. Three entrances: south (main), east and west (side passages).
locations.notes: This is the climactic battle location. Allow creative use of environment. The ritual progresses in stages, adding urgency.

encounters.name: Showdown with Malaketh
encounters.description: The final confrontation with Malaketh as he attempts to complete the ritual. He starts the fight while channeling energy from the Eye of the Deep, gaining benefits but also vulnerability. Every few rounds, the ritual progresses, making the fight more dangerous.

enemies.name: Malaketh the Void-touched
enemies.description: Primary antagonist. Uses warlock spells and void abilities. Gains legendary actions during ritual phases.
enemies.statBlockReference: Custom stat block provided in adventure notes

enemies.name: Void Prophet (Seraphina)
enemies.description: Can be convinced to switch sides or withdraw. If hostile, uses rogue abilities with psychic damage.

enemies.name: Cultist Fanatics
enemies.description: Zealous defenders who will die for their cause. Standard cultist fanatic stats.

environment: Psychic radiation (Wis save DC 14 each round near altar)
outcomes: Partial success: Ritual stopped but Malaketh escapes
Failure: Portal opens (leads to emergency escape scenario)
rewards: Faction rewards based on allies recruited
consequences: Temple begins collapsing if Eye is destroyed
encounters.dmTips: Start with Malaketh in ritual position, needing concentration. Let players disrupt this for advantage. The Void Prophet should be a dramatic moment - let Theron's player drive that interaction. Allied NPCs can handle cultists, keeping focus on main antagonists. Have ritual progress in stages: Round 3 (minor aberrations appear), Round 6 (gravity effects intensify), Round 9 (portal nearly complete). If party is struggling, have allies provide crucial support.
encounters.trigger: Party enters ritual chamber on the night of the full moon

resolution:
With Malaketh defeated and the ritual disrupted, the party must make a critical choice about how to close the gateway. If they destroy the Eye of the Deep, it explodes with psychic energy, sealing the portal but damaging the temple. If they use it to reverse the ritual, the portal closes cleanly but the wielder must make a DC 16 Wisdom save or gain a form of madness. In the aftermath, the temple begins to collapse, and the party must escape.

Seraphina's fate depends on Theron's choices. If redeemed, she helps them escape before succumbing to her wounds, finally recognizing her son. If defeated as an enemy, she dissolves into void energy, leaving only her Harper badge. If allowed to escape, she may appear again as either ally or enemy.

The party emerges from the sewers as dawn breaks over Waterdeep. The city is safe, but they carry the mental scars of what they witnessed. News of their heroism spreads quickly through the factions.
consequences: The cult is broken but scattered remnants remain
Waterdeep's factions owe the party significant favors
Theron has closure about his mother, though it comes with grief
Any corrupted party members need Greater Restoration or similar magic
The Eye of the Deep's fate (destroyed, secured, or lost) has future implications
The party's reputation in Waterdeep grows significantly
rewards: 1500 GP reward from grateful nobles and factions
Each character receives a magic item appropriate to their level
Theron receives his mother's Harper badge and personal effects
Access to Blackstaff Tower's library for research
A deed to a small property in the Dock Ward (future base of operations)

metadata.tone: Dark and intense with moments of hope
